alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued December 06 at 4:44AM EST until December 06 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.9 to 7.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 6:27 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 06/06 AM 7.0 1.2 0.9 N/A Minor 06/07 PM 6.1 0.3 1.0 N/A None 07/07 AM 6.9 1.1 0.7 N/A None 07/07 PM 5.7 -0.1 0.7 N/A None 08/08 AM 6.8 1.0 0.7 N/A None 08/08 PM 5.7 -0.1 0.8 N/A None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
